case_title: CHALLA APPALASWAMY vs COMMISSIONER OF INCOME TAX, A. P.
respondent: COMMISSIONER OF INCOME TAX, A. P.
legal_question: Whether the Appellate Tribunal was right in upholding the refusal of registration of the assessee-firm for the assessment years 1960-61 to 1962-63?

key_clauses.clause_6: Minor partner entitled to profits but not liable for losses.

assessee.contention: The division of profits and losses was in accordance with the partnership deed.
legal_basis: Commissioner of Income Tax v. Sivakasi Match Exporting Co. (1964) 53 ITR 204
S. C. Prashar v. Vasantsen Dwarkadas (1983) 49 ITR (SC) 1

department.contention: The division of profits and losses was not in accordance with the partnership deed.
legal_basis: Commissioner of Income Tax v. S. M. Chaitnavis (1932) 2 Comp. Cas. 464
Calcutta Co. Ltd. v. Commissioner of Income Tax (1959) 37 ITR 1

judgment.reasoning: The division of profits and losses was consistent with the partnership deed, and the refusal of registration was unjustified.
legal_basis: Section 26-A of the Indian Income Tax Act, 1922
Section 30 of the Indian Partnership Act
judgment.decision: Registration was wrongly refused. Question answered in favor of the assessee.

costs_awarded: Department to pay costs to the assessee.
